summary: a 17-year-old previously healthy Caucasian male was admitted to the hospital with fever, malaise, headache, cough and dyspnea. despite prompt clinical improvement under antibiotic therapy, interstitial changes remained stable. despite prompt clinical improvement under antibiotic therapy, interstitial changes remained stable. phenotype is highly variable and carriers without apparent immunodeficiency are still in danger of developing myeloid malignancy. diagnosis should be considered in all patients with diffuse parenchymal lung disease presenting together with leukocytopenia.
